wisdom.text: The mind is everything. What you think, you become.
wisdom.source: Inspired by Dhammapada, adapted for Hindu context
wisdom.reflection: What thoughts will you cultivate today to shape your destiny?
How can you align your actions with truth today?

wisdom.text: Surrender to the Divine with unwavering faith, and grace shall follow.
wisdom.reflection: What does surrender mean to you in your spiritual journey?

wisdom.text: Truth and righteousness triumph over evil.
wisdom.reflection: How can you embody truth and righteousness in your life?

wisdom.text: Perform your duties selflessly, as an offering to the Lord.
wisdom.reflection: How can you serve others without attachment to results?

duty.text: You have the right to perform your prescribed duty, but you are not entitled to the fruits of action.
duty.reflection: How can you focus on your duties without attachment to results?

duty.text: It is better to perform one's own duties imperfectly than to perform the duties of another perfectly.
duty.reflection: What is your unique purpose (svadharma) that only you can fulfill?

valor.text: One should never engage in action for the sake of rewards, nor should one be addicted to inaction.
valor.reflection: What righteous action calls to you today, regardless of outcome?

valor.text: The power of righteousness is greater than the power of might.
valor.reflection: How can you use your strength for dharma today?

rituals.text: The whole universe is a manifestation of the Divine. All actions should be done as offerings to that Divine.
rituals.reflection: How can you make your daily activities into sacred rituals?

rituals.text: May good thoughts come to us from all sides, forever and ever.
rituals.reflection: What sacred intention will guide your day?

peace.text: That is perfect. This is perfect. Perfect comes from perfect. Take perfect from perfect, the remainder is perfect.
peace.reflection: How does recognizing the perfection in all things bring you peace?

peace.text: When the mind becomes silent, the Self reveals itself.
peace.reflection: What practice will help you quiet your mind today?

transformation.text: As a person puts on new garments, giving up old ones, the soul similarly accepts new material bodies, giving up the old and useless ones.
transformation.reflection: What old patterns are you ready to release for your transformation?

transformation.text: The Divine is the source of all creation and dissolution.
transformation.reflection: How can you embrace both creation and letting go in your life?

protection.text: Whenever there is a decline in righteousness and an increase in unrighteousness, I manifest myself.
protection.reflection: How can you be an instrument of preservation and protection today?

protection.text: The Lord sustains all beings, as a thread supports a necklace of pearls.
protection.reflection: How does recognizing the unity of all existence change your perspective?

positive.text: The soul is eternal, all-pervading, unchangeable, immovable, and primordial.
positive.reflection: How does knowing your eternal nature bring you peace today?

positive.text: May we hear with our ears what is auspicious. May we see with our eyes what is auspicious.
positive.reflection: What blessings will you seek and acknowledge today?

positive.text: The happiness which comes from long practice, which leads to the end of suffering, which at first is like poison but at last like nectar - this kind of happiness arises from the tranquility of one's own mind.
positive.reflection: What practice will you commit to for lasting happiness?

positive.text: The wise see the same Divine in a learned priest, a cow, an elephant, a dog, and a dog-eater.
positive.reflection: How will you practice seeing the divine in everyone today?
